title: This is a ...
description: This is a great cooperative game that builds a perfect horror film as you play.    The mechanics force players to separate into groups and explore the house in order to grow his/her character at the same time this makes the haunting more and more likely.  Highly recommend.

title: very slow ...
description: very slow turns, was falling asleep. awfuly bland artwork ie. monster counters that has the terifying word "monster" writen on it instead of a nice graphic.  even the name does not realy convey the horror theme well, though i did like the theme and the scenario book idea is good.

title: Ran throug...
description: Ran through twice.  Love the game, simple to pick up.  The black clips for the players boards are the worst though.

title: Custom 3D ...
description: Custom 3D printed token and clip organizer

title: Nice socia...
description: Nice social game, it doesn't really grab me and whisper in my ear 'play me, play me'. But its good times and lotsa laughs with right crowd.

title: If I wante...
description: If I wanted to listen to a poorly-written and disjointed horror story I would...I dunno...I don't like horror stories so I don't even know where I'd go. I was intensely bored the whole time we played this stupid game.

title: My first c...
description:
My first choice on a great game that needs an expansion. This along with Arkham/Eldritch Horror are great gateway games to bridging the gap between tabletop roleplaying games & board games. If your players like this, there are plenty of horror or modern setting RPGs out there that your players might also like. 

Again, make an expansion for this as with the tile based rooms & heavy story, it would be quite easy to make a new sequel or expansion. Also get rid of the clips for the characters (as a phone app takes care of it better), 75% of mine just slide over the character cards & they are just a bad design over putting a token over that marker instead (if it was a simple rectangle sheet instead of a pentagon).

title: Our family...
description: Our family loves this game, it's a real must have for any serious collection. The 50 different events/stories are just so much fun. Get this game, play it, you will not regret it.

title: This game ...
description: This game is solely for the atmosphere it produces.  Some of the Scenarios are really ridiculous, but at the end of the day I playing because of the crowd.  this game is by far one of my favorite games because its so easy to play and pick up and the feeling it brings for the right crowd is great.

title: Pretty fun...
description: Pretty fun thematic game. Gameplay-wise, there's not heaps there, but as a thematic experience it's pretty good.

title: It's an in...
description: It's an interesting idea but unfortunately falls flat when a lot of the haunts are unclear/broken. It also brings the game to a halt when it happens and feels awkward in execution.

title: Seems like...
description: Seems like a fun filler if you want something that doesn't require much thought. I'm glad I tried it. It's just not my style.

title: This game ...
description: This game is all about the experience of playing and its quite a good experience

title: Interestin...
description: Interesting theme, average mechanics, unbalanced scenarios.

title: Hidden tra...
description: Hidden traitor, that doesn't find out they are the traitor until about halfway through the game. Not really a good mechanism in my opinion.

title: Similar to...
description: Similar to Mansions of Madness, but easier set up and faster play.

title: Great for ...
description:
Great for what it is...a game to chill out and drink a bottle or two of wine during and just have fun even if it doesn't always make sense.

Rating dropped down a bit due to Mansions of Madness. I would never choose Betrayal over MoM.

title: I enjoyed ...
description: I enjoyed it. Simple, thematic, and replayable.

title: I really e...
description: I really enjoyed the cooperative exploring of the house and building of your character in the first half of the game, but then the second half of the game you consult a manual to play out a unique one vs all scenario. The rules for the scenarios aren't all clear and there is no real rhyme or reason to what happens so the game seems to stop for 15 minutes while everyone reads and learns the new rules. The art on the tiles is great, but the character trait clip is flimsy and doesn't line up well.

title: It's not e...
description: It's not exactly "fun" but the mechanical depth and the sheer enjoyment of a haunted house simulator cement this as one of my all time favorite board games.

title: Can't take...
description: Can't take it too seriously or "play to win", but a solid fun game with a load of replay-ability.
